This plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often near freshwater sources, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its reproductive structures are similar to those of early vascular plants, indicating its role in the transition from aquatic to terrestrial life. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, Zosterophyllanthos adeleae is considered a valuable subject for studying plant evolution and ecological adaptation.
